update.description:
Switched to use ign-plugin \(from ign-comon’s PluginLoader\) as it supports unloading plugin libraries. An engine plugin can now be unloaded by calling:

`ignition::rendering::unloadEngine(engineName)`

Updated all tests so that rendering engine is now unloaded and reloaded between each test case.  While doing this, I had to make some changes to make sure ogre objects are cleaned up properly on shutdown. 

This is a step towards running ogre and ogre2 tests one after another.
update.title: Use ign-plugin and support unloading rendering engine plugin libraries

content.raw: Which is the difference between unregister an engine and unload it? Here documentation or comments maybe should explain it… Both destroy the engine but unregister deletes it from engines and unloadengine doesn’t. If that is ok then it should be clear in the method comment I think.
content.html: Which is the difference between unregister an engine and unload it? Here documentation or comments maybe should explain it… Both destroy the engine but unregister deletes it from engines and unloadengine doesn’t. If that is ok then it should be clear in the method comment I think.

content.raw: I wanted to communicate to the user that calling `EngineAt` will cause a change in the state of the object. It compiles fine with `const` because the changes are hidden in the private implementation. So the removal of `const` is mainly for better communication. I'm happy to keep `const` if it’s technically more correct
content.html: I wanted to communicate to the user that calling EngineAt will cause a change in the state of the object. It compiles fine with const because the changes are hidden in the private implementation. So the removal of const is mainly for better communication. I'm happy to keep const if it’s technically more correct

content.raw: oh interesting. I had verified that the plugin was unloaded. So it looks like I don’t need to call  `this->pluginLoader.ForgetLibrary(pathToLib)`. It’s sufficient to just call `ForgetLibraryOfPlugin`. Updated in [f6b90bd](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/f6b90bd1b49450eb5ea71b5ab6fcae463bd93be6)
content.html: oh interesting. I had verified that the plugin was unloaded. So it looks like I don’t need to call this->pluginLoader.ForgetLibrary(pathToLib). It’s sufficient to just call ForgetLibraryOfPlugin. Updated in f6b90bd
